instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
So i am new here and just wanted to ask you guys what to check next if 5v Power rails are missing..

Thanks in advance ! Sorry if I bother you guys..

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Do you get stable <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Any pulse at 5V coil, or other?

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (F7140).

I just have read again.
Please clarify, missing all S5 power rails, or only 5V???

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
Thank you :)
I will answer all of your questions tomorrow :)

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.59V 

I haven't that in my mind rn - will answer tomorrow.

Thx in advance :)

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0.454V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 0,024V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.60V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 0.125V - falling !
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> = 0.00V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0.00V

I hope thats all you need :)

Greetings !

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.
Use surrounding components as test points.

Check for short at 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> and big coils.

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is SMC issue.
Start reballing it...

"[B]green nicht orange light ok[/B]"
Do you get, or not orange light???

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
sorry i get green light and orange light !


Edit:
I now ordered a Stencil to Reball the SMC.
Gonna inform you if something changed !

Do you think the Problem is solved after reballing or should i change the SMC?

Thanks for the help !

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
Change it if no success after reball.

BTW, write new post, instead of edit; not always I see it...

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message: Where can i get a new one ?

threads.title: New here - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green nicht orange light ok - no s5 Power rails
threads.message:
New SMC doesn't serve; MUST be picked up from same board model.

Did you reball it and no success?

threads.message:
